page.title: 03South west Nercwys _ Farming
page.content: {Farming on marginal land.} This area has mainly dairy farming using mostly Friesian cows. Sheep farming is also very much part of the area as is cattle rearing for the fat-stock market. It is mainly good quality arable land, with some bog land. Growing crops are cereals, barley and oats, some rape is also grown for sheep feed. Grass is cut for silage and hay. The farms in this area are quite large for this part of Clwyd, owned for the most part by the same families for generations. There are a few small holdings, with sheep and young stock for the beef market. One farm has just started rabbit farming. The rabbits are sold to a retailer for meat, as are chickens in some parts of the area.
